snippet: The world’s largest computer chip maker has been struggling in a market where people are doing more of their computing on tablets and smartphones.
abstract: Intel reports a sharp decline in its quarterly profits as its financial performance follows the declining fortunes of the personal computer industry; company reports net income of $2.05 billion, a decline of 25 percent from $2.74 billion a year earlier; earnings fell to 40 cents a share, down from 53; revenue in the first quarter slipped to $12.58 billion, down from $12.91 billion.
lead_paragraph: The world’s largest computer chip maker has been struggling in a market where people are doing more of their computing on tablets and smartphones.

headline.seo: Intel Profits Fall as PC Slump Cuts Demand for Chips
headline.main: Intel’s Profit Falls 25% With Decline in Chip Sales
headline.print_headline: Intel’s Profit Falls 25% With Decline In Chip Sales
